zone.line: And from the waves, sound like delight,
So as we rode we talked, & the swift thought
Winging itself with laughter, lingered not
But flew from brain to brain, such glee was
Choorged with light memories of remembered hours
None deep enought for sadness — till we came
Homeward — whch. always makes the spirits tame
The day had been cheerful, but cold; & now
The sun was sinking, & the wind also.—
Our talk grew somewhat serious, as may be
As mocks itself, because it cannot scorn
Yet pleasing, such as once, so poets tell,
